exclusions: Nasal discharge (clear or purulent) or cough
Neonate with respiratory distress or apnea with contacts with a viral illness (cough, cold, runny nose, fever)
Neonate with severe hypoxemia and lactic acidosis require on-call cardiologist approval prior to accepting
Cardiac Surgery patients - requires on-call cardiologist approval prior to accepting
Cystic Fibrosis - acute/chronic complications of CF
Maternal patient requiring ICU Level Care and/or Placenta Accreta, HELLP Syndrome, Eclamptic Seizure/Eclampsia, Mass Transfusion, Post CPR/ROSC, Sepsis, Telemetry Monitoring
Transplant – rejection or recent surgery (including BMT)

general_exclusions: Greater than 21 years of age, unless current TCH patient
No change in level of care or services provided
Burn patients >10% or perineal burns, airway burns
Sexual Assault requiring SANE Exam – only coverage Monday 1000-Friday 2300

TCH_WOODLANDS.display_name: Texas Children's Hospital Community Sites Admission Exclusion Criteria

exclusions: HFNC (max flow for cannula size and not improving)
Hourly or q2 hr assessments/treatments without expected imminent improvement
Hypothermia (<97F), q1 temp checks, Bare hugger warmer
Specialty care not available at Community Site
Congenital heart disease in the neonatal period, regardless of severity
Unstable congenital and acquired heart disease
Kawasaki with evidence of toxic shock syndrome or moderate/severe coronary artery dilation
Endocarditis in patients not approved by CT surgery
Need for procedures requiring CV anesthesia
accept: Status post cardiac repair (>6wks), unless not approved by CT surgery
Unrepaired and stable biventricular heart disease (except in neonatal period)
Status post-transplant (with preserved systolic function) admitted for non-cardiac etiology
Kawasaki with no evidence of toxic shock syndrome
clinical_team_decision: Status post Glenn/Fontan palliation, admitted for non-cardiac etiology
Cardiac diagnosis with palliative/comfort care
Cardiomyopathy patients with compensated heart failure (EF > 45%) not requiring IV inotropic support
Stable Kawasaki with mildly dilated coronaries (unless not cleared by Kawasaki team)
Stable previous diagnosis of myocarditis/myopericarditis (unless not cleared by HF/TX team)
Endocarditis in patients with known congenital heart disease (to complete treatment after initiation)
History of pacemaker placement admitted for non-cardiac diagnosis (unless not cleared by EP team)
Status post successful cardioversion for monitoring (unless not cleared by EP team)

exclusions: Diabetes in DKA, HCO3 <15 (requiring insulin drip)
accept: Diabetes, new onset Type 1 or 2, not in DKA
clinical_team_decision: Diabetes in DKA, mild ketosis, HCO3 >15

exclusions: Hyperbilirubinemia – TSB within 2 below exchange level
GI bleed with hemodynamic instability (Hgb drop =/> 3 g/dl or Hgb 8-10 g/dl if unknown baseline)
Gallstone pancreatitis/biliary obstruction suspected and need for ERCP
Acute liver failure (INR>=2 or >1.5 w/ mental status changes)
Known metabolic disorder with risk of neurologic compromise or specialized formulas
IR procedures requiring catheter directed thrombolysis
Bone marrow transplant patients still under care of BMT team
clinical_team_decision: Allogenic or autologous transplant pts no longer under care of BMT team (Discuss w/ Onc)
Deep venous thrombosis (NOTE: if new onset, large DVT, consider tx to MC for other specialized care)

exclusions: Suspected bacterial meningitis in infant (1st 24 hours of admission): <60 days: CSF +GS +/-pleocytosis; >60 days-12 mos: meningitis score >/=2; ill-appearance any age
Intracranial process (bleed, mass) or need for intracranial monitoring
Presence of altered mental status (not improving)
Seizure in neonate <30 days (needs continuous EEG)
Vagal nerve stimulator or baclofen pump malfunction/infection
Aggressive Behavioral Health Patients Requiring Multiple Medication Interventions
psychiatric.notes: During weekends and/or holidays when no in-person or telehealth available, patients with acute psychosis requiring urgent psychiatry evaluation should be transferred/direct admitted to Main Campus for in-person psychiatry consult

exclusions: Post-septal involvement, abscess, rapid progression, or need for frequent eye exams/surgical intervention
Atypical presentation (no source of infection, concern for malignancy, etc.)
accept: Pre-septal cellulitis without concern for post-septal involvement (Note: if <2 yrs, strongly consider CT to exclude orbital involvement)

exclusions: Oliguric renal failure requiring close fluid management
Electrolyte abnormalities needing q1-2 blood draws or medications
Cystic fibrosis patients with complications of CF
Kawasaki needing Rheum evaluation (Not responding to 1st line tx, age <12 mos, coronary artery dilatations- discuss with Rheum)
New diagnosis or worsening underlying primary rheumatologic conditions
Suspected/confirmed MIS-C with evidence of cardiac failure
clinical_team_decision: Suspected/confirmed MIS-C without evidence of shock
ac_exclusion_picu_accept: Suspected/confirmed MIS-C with evidence of shock (tachycardia refractory to aggressive fluid resuscitation [>60 cc/kg], AMS, etc.)

exclusions: Venous studies: Lesions with airway, head, or neck involvement
clinical_team_decision: Other venous/lymphatic malformations

exclusions: Infants weighing <2.5 kg (except at The Woodlands with bed availability)
Neonates requiring subspecialty consultation at birth
clinical_team_decision: Neonates up to 44 weeks post-gestational age
nicu.notes: Neonatology acceptance at The Woodlands Campus if bed availability. Discussion with neonatology service prior to acceptance from outside hospital.

general_exclusions: Specialty care not available at Community Site

campus_notes.overview: There is an on-site pediatric hospitalist and PICU attending available for admission/consultation of patients 24/7. The clinical team will determine if the special needs of the patient can be addressed at the community sites. Decisions are made based on the skills set of the clinical team, availability of consultants, and specialty care.
campus_notes.ac_exclusion_picu_accept: AC Exclusion means patients will be admitted to PICU at the community campus.
campus_notes.community_exclusion: Community Exclusion means patients should be transferred to Main Campus.
campus_notes.clinical_team: The Clinical Team is defined as: Physician responsible for care, RN responsible for care, Physician receiving the patient, and NAC equivalent.
campus_notes.trauma: See the TCH Trauma Services SharePoint for full trauma exclusions and algorithms. Certain trauma patients involving only one organ system or with mild complications may be admitted to Acute Care at Community Sites to appropriate surgical service. All non-accidental trauma patients and all head trauma with complications should be transferred to the Medical Center Campus.
